alert.note: Alert for Edgecombe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 23 at 2:47AM EDT until further notice by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Edgecombe, Franklin, Halifax, Johnston, Nash, Sampson, Vance, Warren, Wayne and Wilson. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain associated with Tropical Storm Ophelia may result in flooding. Rainfall amounts of 4 to 7 inches are expected with locally higher amounts possible. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
